clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Cholesterol Lowering Effects of Two Marketed Products in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Hypercholesterolemia (MK-0653A-077)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel Group, 6-Week Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Combination Tablet Versus Atorvastatin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) and Hypercholesterolemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this 10-week study is to compare the reduction in cholesterol following treatment with two different marketed drugs, in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypercholesterolemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent reduction in LDL-C from baseline after 6 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of patients attaining LDL-C <70 mg/dl after 6 weeks of treatment

intervention.intervention_name: Duration of Treatment: 4 wk placebo run in then 6 wk active

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women aged 18 to 79 years who have a confirmed diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus with elevated cholesterol levels may be eligible to participate in a study to assess the efficacy and safety of the two marketed drugs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus that is poorly controlled
